articles.title: US judge rules Apple violated order to reform App Store
articles.content: Apple violated a US court order that required the iPhone maker to allow greater competition for app downloads and payment methods in its lucrative App Store and will be referred to federal prosecutors, a federal judge in California ruled on Wednesday.

articles.title: Amazon and Apple earnings coverage, Eli Lilly: What to Watch
articles.content: Market Domination Overtime hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton preview several of the biggest stories and reports due out tomorrow, Thursday, May 1, including Apple (AAPL) and Amazon's (AMZN) respective quarterly earnings results alongside Eli Lilly (LLY), Mastercard (MA), McDonald's (MCD), and CVS Health (CVS). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

articles.title: Court sides with Fortnite maker Epic as Apple sanctioned for defying order in App Store case
articles.content: A federal judge has strongly rebuked Apple, finding that the iPhone maker willfully violated a court injunction in an antitrust case filed by “Fortnite maker Epic Games. U.S. District Judge Yvonne...

articles.title: Apple Stock Gets Price-Target Cuts On Tariff Headwinds
articles.content: At least three Wall Street analysts have cut their price targets on Apple stock ahead of the iPhone maker's March-quarter report, due late Thursday.

articles.title: Amazon Plans to Build Dozens of US Warehouses in Rural Expansion
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Amazon.com Inc. plans to build dozens of warehouses to serve rural areas in the US before the end of next year, growing its footprint as the company works to rely less on other carriers. articles.title: Apple Must Explain How It Can Dodge a Trade War as It Reports Earnings
articles.content: Apple earnings are coming, and Wall Street is looking for where the company stands amid tariff, economic, and artificial intelligence uncertainty.  Analysts surveyed by FactSet expect Apple to post adjusted earnings of $1.62 a share on revenue of $94.4 billion.  “Investors will likely be focused on Apple’s messaging on the impact from tariffs and we expect the Jun-qtr guide to be the main incremental data point around how Apple is thinking about tariffs,” Evercore ISI analyst Amit Daryanani wrote in a note on Monday.

articles.title: Veteran Investor Joe Terranova Is “Concerned” About Apple Inc. (AAPL)
articles.content: Appearing on CNBC yesterday, veteran investor Joe Terranova, the senior managing director and chief market strategist of Virtus Investment, said that he was “concerned” about Apple’s (AAPL) outlook due to its lack of revenue growth.
